string.text: Barkeep said you've been looking for me?

Marked One! Speak of the devil... Good ol' Sakharov gave me another job. Mutants which used to only inhabit Radar have been sighted recently in some places that were relatively quiet before. They want to make a device or something to track mutant migration patterns. Should be a really promising job.
So let them make it. How on earth did you get involved in this?

I promised Sakharov that I would contact the Hunters through my own channels. They will assist in tracking the uncommon mutants down. But... they refuse to kill them themselves. It's a matter of principle they say.
Principles... hadn't noticed they had any. So what do you want from me?

For the tracking to be more precise, the device needs to be tuned to the DNA of a specific mutant. If only they had their body parts in sufficient quantities, the job would have progressed much faster.
So what mutants are they trying to track?
The most dangerous ones, I think: bloodsuckers, chimeras, controllers, pseudogiants.
That's one hell of a job. The dangerous ones. So much for their principles.
I've contacted the Hunters. They promised to tell me when they track the specific creatures down. So, do you agree to help Sakharov out?
I may agree to help. I'd like to know what I get out of this though. As far as I understand, you didn't take the burden of science upon yourself for mere gratitude.

Sakharov got me some ammo and medicines. So I'll compensate your expenses in excess. And after you complete the job, you'll have exclusive access to the knowledge of the uncommon creatures' whereabouts. You won't have to run around the entire Zone if you need a specific mutant part. So, do you agree?
Nah, Docent, I'll manage without this job.
Deal. I'll be waiting for any further news.
Suit yourself, I'll find someone else to take the job.
Trust me, you won't regret it.
Take care... researcher.
\nDocent needs three jaws from the bloodsuckers inhabiting Dark Valley.
I've seen the message, have you been looking for me?
Our conversation about the device, do you remember it? I have some info about a bloodsucker lair. You still interested?
So where have they seen them? I hope I won't need to run across the entire Zone for them.
I don't have time right now, I'll come back later.
No, it's not far, just over in the Dark Valley. The Hunters told me they've seen a pack of these suckers. They were of some special variety, they said.
So... that's all?
You'll have to try to cut out three jaws to bring back.
Deal, I'll bring you the jaws.
Three?! I don't like this idea.
I've got their lair marked in your PDA. Here, have some ammo.
Suit yourself, I'll find someone else to take the job.
Take care... researcher.
I brought you the mutant parts for the device.
Device? What device?
Don't be a laggard, Docent. I've brought three jaws, just like we agreed.
Ah, jaws, now I remember.
Take them, they are starting to smell already. Those turned out to be some fierce suckers.
Yeah, I asked the Hunters to choose the most seasoned ones. They have the purest DNA, or so I've been told.
I did my part of the job. What about the reward?
Sure, take this. And here's a bonus to drink to a successful deal.
Speak to me again if you need something else.
\nDocent needs three claws from chimeras inhabiting the Tunnel.
I've seen the message, have you been looking for me?
Our conversation about the device, do you remember it? I have some info about a chimera lair. Are you ready to continue our research?
Where have they seen them?
I don't have time right now, I'll come back later.
Here, it's not far. You've been to the Tunnel before, right? The Hunters told me that they've seen several specimens here.
So... what is expected from me this time?
Five claws are needed to tune the device, I think it should be enough.
What?! You'll get exhausted just from cutting a single one. Do you know how much ammo is going to be wasted?
Well, so get me three then, at least.
I won't risk my ass for nothing.
I'll try to compensate you with some ammo and medicine, and I'll tip a little extra.
Deal. Go ahead and mark them in my PDA.
I don't like this idea.
I've got their lair marked in your PDA. Here's a little something...
Suit yourself, I'll find someone else to take the job.
Take care... researcher.
I've brought the claws for the device.
Claws... what claws?
Docent, did you hit your head?
Sorry, now I remember.
Take these claws. Those turned out to be some fierce chimeras.
Yeah, I asked the hunters to choose the most seasoned ones. They have the purest DNA, or so I've been told.
Do you remember our deal? I'm waiting.
Fair and square. Take it.
Speak to me again if you need something else.
\nDocent needs two hands from controllers inhabiting the Swamps.
I've seen the message, have you been looking for me?
Our conversation about the device, do you remember it? I have some info about a couple of controllers. I hope you haven't changed your mind about our research?
Where have they seen them?
I don't have time right now, I'll come back later.
Here, it's not far. You've been to the Swamps before, right? The Hunters told me that they've seen some of their breed there.
So... What do you want from me this time?
Only two hands are needed to tune the detector. I think that should be enough.
How did controllers end up at the Swamps? It's a quiet place... or at least it was. Dogs and boars running about, tushkanos murmuring about something.
The device is being made precisely for that purpose - to understand mutant migration paths exactly. Can you imagine that?
You'd better imagine my reward. A controller is a dangerous creature, you can't just sneak up on it. I'll need a good rifle with a scope.
I'll help you with obtaining such a rifle. And also with ammo and medicine, as per usual. I'll even throw in little something extra. Deal?
Deal, mark those telepaths on my PDA.
I don't like this idea.
I've got their usual location marked in your PDA.
Suit yourself, I'll find someone else to take the job.
Take care... researcher.
I've brought the hands
Hands, whose hands?!
Have you been drinking lately?
Ah, controller hands. Now I remember
Take them, they're already starting to smell. They turned out to be especially fierce controllers.
Yeah, I asked the hunters to choose the most seasoned ones. They have the purest DNA, or so I've been told.
I've already heard about them being seasoned. Where's my reward?

I have a belt with 4 artifact slots, or, if you need it, I can give you a scope for a sniper rifle. Some stalker gave it to me as a deposit for my work. He promised to pay me after making some money, but I haven't seen him for a long time. He's probably dead already.
Are you trying to play me for a fool, Docent? Alright, give me the belt.
I want the scope, but I'm starting to dislike our partnership.
The belt, new and shiny. Quite a battery hog though.
Here, cool stuff. You can see a mosquito's leg in detail through it.
Take care... researcher.
\nTwo hands from pseudogiants inhabiting Radar are needed to tune Docent's detector.
Barkeep said you've been missing me.
Marked One, where have you been? Do you remember our deal and the device? I have some info about a couple of pseudogiants. What do you think, are you still willing to participate in our research?
Where have they seen them?
I don't have time right now, I'll come back later.
In the Red Forest, near Radar. After disabling the Brain Scorcher the way is now relatively safe.
Safe?! How about you take me on a vacation there then?
Marked One, we are almost finished. Only some small details are left to work out.
Everything is a small detail to you. Do you realize that there's more dogs per square meter than rats in the entire Bar?
Yes, I understand. But nobody else would help me. You see, there's almost nobody left. Some Hunters have seen the pseudogiants from the hill, but were too cowardly to enter the forest.
More like the clever ones... What are you offering as a reward?
I've heard you've got a storage problem. I can rent my own stash to you for a small fee. guarantee it's security.
Small, you say... Alright, deal, mark them on my PDA
I don't like this idea.
I've marked their location on your PDA map
Suit yourself, I'll find someone else to take the job.
Take care... researcher..
I've brought the hands for the device.
Hands, what for?
Have you already forgotten, Docent?
Ah, yes, good thing you're here to remind me.
Take them, they're already starting to smell. Those turned out to be really fierce pseudogiants.
Yeah, I asked the hunters to choose the most seasoned ones. They have the purest DNA, or so I've been told.
What's been our deal?
Your loot. Or its safety, to be more precise.
What a tricky partner you are, Docent. When will the device be ready? It will be interesting to see the results.
Hell, you are quick. It's science, brother. Maybe this week, maybe a bit later. I'll have to check the core functionality. Go on now, I'm busy.
Then go work, I'll leave you to it.
Docent, so how is the device?
Ah, Marked One. I've encountered a problem, that's why I called you
I won't go anywhere, don't even ask me to.
I'm not asking you to go anywhere. Something is wrong with the damned device, maybe I miscalculated something, or they made an error. But there are no results from it yet.
What, was all this for nothing? How do I get my time, health and sanity back? That's not a proper way to do business.
I understand, but who could have expected this. They assured me that everything would come out right.
Docent, you might not live through the day when letting people down like that... your conscience will torture you to death.

Hold on now, no need to be hasty. I can partially compensate for your trouble. I have some info I found in some stalker's PDA. Honestly, I don't have anything else, I invested the rest of my money in this device.
Your honesty is very much appreciated. What info do you have?
A stash. Judging by the description, it's full of loot.
Yeah, and it's in the middle of nowhere, as usual. You know what Docent, screw you, your device, the mutants, and the Zone as well.
What? Do you have some screws loose in your head?
Yes, I do have some screws loose in my head! Understood?!
\nMikhalych asked me to find the lost devices. I have to look for an abandoned military convoy, somewhere at the east of the Tesla zone.
Why are you looking at me like that, what do you want?
I have a little problem. If you help us, or rather myself, then I'll pay you well.
What's the problem? And I'd like to know beforehand, what exactly do you mean by paying well?
Professor Sakharov, that guy sitting in a tin can at Yantar, contacted me. The point is that two particularly valuable devices were lost in that goddamn Tesla zone.
Understood. What about the reward?

Alright, listen. You surely know that artifacts have different properties. Some are better, some are worse. For example, there's "Medusa" which radiate those roentgens like crazy, but protects against telepathy and who knows what else, and there's that radioactive... thing, that doesn't protect from anything. Although Medusa is always Medusa, even in Africa, and in the mainland they won't be able to tell which one is radioactive and which one isn't. It's more important here, in the Zone, for a simple stalker, if it protects your ass without any radiation.\nSee, that's where a business is born: if you need a good artifact, you come to me and give me two poor artifacts, and I give you a better one. Deal?
If I agree, where do I find these devices for Sakharov? The Tesla zone isn't exactly the place to look under every bush for an entire day.
Nah, I don't need it.

They've been lost in sector 23. The approximate location is the military convoy in the eastern part of the Tesla zone. The devices aren't very heavy, about five kilograms each. I've already told several stalkers about this problem, but I think you have this... potential for the important jobs.
That's unfortunate, but it's your call.
I'll try to look for them, but I can't promise anything.
Mikhalych, I've found those goddamn "devices".
I hope they aren't radioactive at least? I don't want any radiation here.
No. But those "devices" look more like containers. Maybe there's something inside?
Containers or not, what do you care? If there's something inside, let Sakharov examine it. Our job was just to find it, understand?
Take them then, it's better to leave the scientists to their work.
Yeah, they don't seem to be radioactive. Interesting, what could have been so important to take out from the Tesla zone that they needed an entire military convoy?
So these really are containers?!
That's not your business. Here, for your troubles, and you can bring me the artifacts. I will trade for them.
Not much... It's clear whose friend you are.
